page.title: 17LOCAL NEWS:HOSPITAL TO CLOSE
page.content: Thorpe Maternity Hospital is to close next year in February 1986 and the buildings converted into a special unit for the elderly.That was the decision of the Sunderland and health Authority which published its long-awaited report on the future of the small hospital near Easington village. Thorpe hospital has an excellent record and reputation.The 63 staff employed at the hospital could be transfered to either Sunderland or Hartlepool but eventually,a complete new maternity unit will be developed at Sunderland.An action unit has benn set up and has pledged to battle on for the maternity unit.The committee has taken the acronym BIRTHS.It is preparing a document outlining the case for keeping the maternity services at Thorpe.This will be sent to the Health Minister.
